1: Job's Reply. 1 Then Job answered and said:[a]
2: What help you give to the powerless, what strength to the feeble arm!
3: How you give counsel to one without wisdom; how profuse is the advice you offer!
4: With whose help have you uttered those words, whose breath comes forth from you?
5: The shades[b] beneath writhe in terror, the waters, and their inhabitants.
6: Naked before him is Sheol,[c] and Abaddon has no covering.
7: He stretches out Zaphon[d] over the void, and suspends the earth over nothing at all;
8: He binds up the waters in his clouds, yet the cloud is not split by their weight;
9: He holds back the appearance of the full moon by spreading his clouds before it.
10: He has marked out a circle[e] on the surface of the deep as the boundary of light and darkness.
11: The pillars of the heavens tremble and are stunned at his thunderous rebuke;
12: By his power he stilled Sea, by his skill he crushed Rahab;[f]
13: By his wind the heavens were made clear, his hand pierced the fleeing serpent.[g]
14: Lo, these are but the outlines of his ways, and what a whisper of a word we hear of him: Who can comprehend the thunder of his power?
